fields.headline: News
fields.bodyText: Well placed: Microchip giant Intel has scooped the top prize in this year's National Council for Work Experience (NCWE) Awards. The company topped a shortlist of four other category winners: marketing firm Identex in the over-10 and under-250 employees category; workplace communications agency CHA in the under-10 employees group; the Inland Revenue in the public sector category; and Groundwork Oldham and Rochdale, an environmental regeneration charity, in the voluntary and charitable sector category. Students make up 10% of Intel's workforce in Swindon. "Intel impressed us with its efforts to immerse students in the culture of the company and develop social ties with other students in addition to the sound structure and management of its internship programme," says NCWE director Liz Rhodes. Shine on: Strategic brand design agency Coley Porter Bell has extended the deadline for its SHINE 2004 award to June 14. The award is open to second year graphic design students graduating in 2005. Students are required to submit a single piece of work (photocopies are acceptable) from their second year portfolio that they feel best showcases their unique talent. The winner will receive a prize of £3,000 and a three month paid placement at Coley Porter Bell. For details see www.cpb.co.uk ·Rise is edited by Ian Wylie ian.wylie@theguardian.com
